intro: Fevillea trilobata var. subuniflora, commonly known as the narrow-leaved fevillea, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are typically ovate to lanceolate in shape. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or white, and it is often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
